snippet: Peace talks that ended in December failed to produce an agreement and prompted analysts to question whether the divided government can, or even wants to, reach a deal.
abstract: Addis Ababa Memo; gathering of Sudanese officials, rebels, politicians, activists and international observers in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia, offers new hope that peace accord can be struck; after talks failed in December 2014, analysts are wondering whether divided Sudanese government, can, or even really wants to, reach a deal.
lead_paragraph: Peace talks that ended in December failed to produce an agreement and prompted analysts to question whether the divided government can, or even wants to, reach a deal.

headline.print_headline: A Moment of Optimism on Sudan Peace Fades as New Talks Approach
headline.main: A Moment of Optimism on Sudan Peace Fades as New Talks Approach
